metadata.titel_preek: The Transfiguration: The Manifestation of Uncreated Light

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God reveals His uncreated glory through the person of Jesus Christ to transform and draw humanity into His presence.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Son... acting at the creation
I will draw all men to myself
manifestation of Jesus’ unique divine glory
the glory as of the only Son from the Father
God is the sole giver of light
the voice was borne to him from the Majestic Glory
glory that the Church may share
mediated so that human beings can receive it

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Word / Mediated Revelation
tekstueel_bewijs: the power of the living Word
empowered by faith precisely in that one who is at work in you

tegenstander.identificatie: The Ruler of this World / Sinful Human Limitation
tekstueel_bewijs: now shall the ruler of this world be cast out
human beings in our present sinful and limited condition
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but the 'ruler of this world' and the ontological gap between sinful man and uncreated light.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transformation of the believer's life (Ethics/Sanctification) as a result of the primary manifestation.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (empowered by God)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon explicitly states that the 'new human being' is not achieved by human means but is a gift of the transfigured Lord.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God the Father → The Doxa/Glory → The Church
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Word/Spirit → God/Christ ← The Ruler of this World
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: Christ → Drawing all men to Himself

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus... will draw all men to myself.

voorbeelden: teaching them to observe all that I have commanded you
This important theological concept... can help us understand.
the one who is able to give power to do the will of the Father
empowered by faith precisely in that one who is at work in you

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power) granted by God, rather than the 'Devoir' (Obligation) of man. Grace is the endowment of competence.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the inaccessible Light (S1) through the mediated Cloud (~S2) to the Darkness of the Cross (S2), resulting in the Transfigured Life (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension between God's holiness and man's sin is resolved in Christ being 'lifted up' (Crucifixion as Glorification).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'ruler of this world' and the 'apparent defeat' at Golgotha are central.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly critiques moralistic 'exhortations' and maintains God as the primary actor in both salvation and the power for ethics.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Instead of focusing on Jesus... the preacher will... [turn] the story into an exhortation to the people in the pews to stop looking for mountaintop experiences.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The transfiguration of human nature... is not achieved by human means. It is the gift of God.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The sermon explicitly rejects using Peter as a negative moral example to drive people to 'the valley'.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: None (Peter is mentioned as a foil for what NOT to do in preaching)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: The focus is on Jesus' glory, not the disciples' failure.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Awe, wonder, and a sense of being empowered by an external source.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative hierarchy is perfectly maintained: the primary program (God's glory) enables the secondary program (human transformation).
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'uncreated light' and the 'darkness' of the cross.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: When we know that we participate in God’s forward-moving purposes...

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment: 'empowered by faith precisely in that one who is at work in you'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High: 'present sinful and limited condition' makes God's essence inaccessible.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the Subject of the narrative engine.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it effectively counters the Devoir (Must) of moralism.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Continue to ground 'doing the will' in 'being empowered'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The 'ruler of this world' is a sufficiently cosmic opponent.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in grace-oriented actantial structure, successfully avoiding the 'moralistic trap' of the Transfiguration text.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric might focus on the 'mountaintop' metaphor, Greimasian analysis reveals that the 'engine' of the sermon is God's agency, not human effort.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the 'uncreated light'; semiotics shows how that light functions as the 'Object' that the 'Subject' (God) transmits to the 'Receiver' (Man).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals the explicit rejection of the 'Subject-switch' where the hearer is usually told to 'do' something to get off the mountain.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Rutledge Rule' effectively, ensuring God remains the subject of the most significant active verbs.
